alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Franklin; Pickaway (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 11:17PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, FAIRFIELD AND NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1117 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Canal Winchester, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Ashville, Baltimore, Bremen, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Royalton, Lithopolis, Thurston, Carroll, Sugar Grove, Rushville, West Rushville, Fairfield County Airport, US Route 22 at State Route 159, Slate Run Metro Park, North Berne and Dumontville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
